description:
Nearly twenty years into the 21st century, people have forgotten the existence of Yokai. When a number of unexplainable phenomena plague adults of the human world with confusion and chaos, thirteen-year-old Mana writes a letter to the Yokai Post in search of answers, only to be greeted by Ge Ge Ge no Kitaro...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Body Image
tags.description: Features themes of self-esteem concerning perceived defects or flaws in appearance, such as body weight or disfigurement, and may discuss topics such as eating disorders, fatphobia, and body dysmorphia.

name.native: 八岐大蛇or ヤマタノオロチ or やまたのおろち

node.description:
A Japanese mangaka, illustrator and a leading researcher in youkai painting and youkai research. Although born in Osaka, he was raised in Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture. In 1943, during World War II, he joined army as a soldier under New Guinea Front - Rabaul. After many harsh war experiences, he lost his left arm in an attack by the US. 

He debuted in 1958 with his work "Rocketman." From 1960, he started releasing one of his most famous works "GeGeGe no Kitaro" series. For a while he worked for rental magazines, until 1964, when he debuted for his first commercial magazine, i.e, Garo. As a youkai researcher, he has served as president of the World Youkai Association , a member of the Japanese Folklore Society, and a member of the Council of the Folk Art Society.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

SCANDAL is a Japanese pop rock group who proclaim themselves as "The Most Powerful Japanese Girlie Pop Rock". 

Members:
[HARUNA](https://anilist.co/staff/248116/Haruna-Ono) - Vocals and rhythm guitar 
[TOMOMI](https://anilist.co/staff/248117/Tomomi-Ogawa) - Vocals and bass 
[MAMI](https://anilist.co/staff/248115/Mami-Sasazaki) - Vocals and lead guitar  
[RINA](https://anilist.co/staff/248118/Rina-Suzuki) - Vocals and drum
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dinahasegawa)

Hasegawa Keiichi was a secondary writer on Kamen Rider W, Kamen Rider Fourze, Kamen Rider Drive and Kamen Rider Ghost. He is more known for his work on the Ultra Series, having written for every Ultraman series produced since Tiga (except for Ultraman Max), he has written more material for the franchise than any other writer.

He also played a drunken man in Kamen Rider W Returns: Kamen Rider Accel.

(Source: Kamen Rider Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.
